title: Strengthening Data Science Practical Competencies: Simulation/VR Learning Design and Evaluation Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of cognitive psychology, experience with simulation/VR tools
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can measure mental workload using NASA-TLX, Workload Profile, and RSME tools in simulation/VR environments.
Learners can apply the three types of cognitive load (intrinsic, extraneous, germane) from Cognitive Load Theory (CLT) to actual learning design.
Learners can compare and optimize cognitive load between two instructional conditions (e.g., step-by-step vs. integrated simulation) using self-report measurement tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
